name: Alyssa Battams
review: Nikon 50mm lens excellent sharpness at f4 also good for macro with extension tubes , This lens is invaluable. Put simply, if you don't own it, you need to!

name: Sebastien O'Cridigan
review: Very good case, I loved it but sold to move into the world of the mirrorless with Fujifilm .I picked this up a few days ago to have a lighter fast prime.

name: Candice Pound
review: I wanted this lens to accompany my kit lenses.It is perfect for getting that awesome background or foreground blur!.with my 60mm 1: 1.8 AF Micro

name: Jerrold Goodrich
review: This camera has a fixed screen. The D5300 screen is fully articulating, meaning you can open and tilt it so you can shoot from any angle.

name: Goldina Gavahan
review: This isn't a deal breaker, but Nikon offers several color profiles that you can upload to your camera. For example, I used to shoot with Velvia film on my F3

name: Kellina Wolfart
review: This camera does not have a microphone port. If you want to videotape your children playing and capture their conversation, you're stuck using the onboard mic.

name: Mylo Barz
review: I will admit that the lens can be a bit the DSLR universe, but I will say that after you play with the camera for a while, you will know all of the menus!

name: Pauli Klambt
review: I have bought my 28-300L some months ago and use it all around Galapagos Islands.I think I'll will never find a better lens like this one. It is totally awesome.

name: Leroi Bengough
review: Superb lens.  I have had it a long time ... about 6 years + I think.  I originally got it for a 10D and then a 1DS II ... it is now used on a 5D III.

name: Kerrie Colegrove
review: I had replace my 50-500mm for this one. At the time, the only issue is the image above ISO800.  The 3D Color Matrix Metering is outsanding .

name: Susie Clamp
review: This lens brought new life into my basic rebel T5. The focus is quicker, captures more light, and the depth of field is amazing.

name: Cleveland Thresher
review: So you're buying your first lens outside of the standard kit lens? This 50mm needs to be it It's a steal and it needs to be in your collection.its gonna be your!

name: Mitchel Balch
review: Superb lens.  I have had it a long time ... about 6 years + I think.  I originally got it for a 10D and then a 1DS II ... it is now used on a 5D III.

name: Dicky Wilcock
review: This lens is so amazing! Anyone can become a professional photographer with this lens! You just need to play around with it a bit to get used to it

name: Vicki Clarey
review: This has been a good lens to have around for the summer time candid shots.  Fast enough to capture detail and very light weight.
